intro: Gymnosporia huillensis, commonly known as the Huillén thornbush, is a shrub native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Cactaceae and is characterized by its spiny stems and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant produces small, woody fruits that contain seeds, typical of gymnosporangiate structures. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting to poor soil conditions. Due to its ecological significance and limited distribution, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
